name: academic
description: Scientific scholarly-style publications, typically educative and/or explorative and covering complex topics in the world of crypto and DeFi

name: aggregator
description: Protocols that collect and unify different protocols in similar categories and combine them for improved user experience

name: amm
description: Automated Market Makers allow people to exchange coins based on built-in autonomous mechanisms instead of dealing with intermediaries

name: analytics
description: Data-driven analysis of crypto projects

name: arbitrage
description: Arbitrage is the trading style of quickly buying and selling the same coin on different markets in order to profit from the price difference with low risk

name: cex
description: Centralized Exchanges where people can exchange their crypto

name: centralised-exchange
description: Centralized Exchanges where people can exchange their crypto

name: dao
description: Decentralized Autonomous Organisation

name: dapp
description: dApps are computer applications that run on decentralized networks such as Ethereum or Solana

name: decentralised-exchange
description: Decentralized Exchanges are protocols built on blockchains that allow people to trade crypto using Automated Market Makers

name: defi
description: Decentralized Finance, a broad term used for financial protocols built on decentralized blockchains

name: developer
description: Sites and tools to help you build your own applications or contribute to existing ones within crypto

name: dex
description: Decentralized Exchanges are protocols built on blockchains that allow people to trade crypto using Automated Market Makers

name: divergence-loss
description: Also known as impermanent loss, a potential risk of supplying liquidity of coins whose prices diverge over time

name: education
description: General educative content

name: buy-crypto
description: Exchanges and wallets where you are able to buy crypto

name: gas
description: In context of Ethereum and similar dApp networks, gas refers to the cost to perform a transaction on the network.

name: insight
description: Educative but perhaps opinionated pieces written by experts, about current market structure or various protocols

name: insurance
description: Find ways to insure your cryptocurrency

name: jobs
description: As a booming new industry, crypto offers many new job opportunities. Find them here

name: lending
description: Lending and borrowing go hand in hand and are one of the main financial primitives

name: leverage
description: Leverage allows traders to borrow money from the exchange in order to amplify the potential gains or losses

name: liquidity
description: Liquidity is the abundance of a cryptocurrency in a market - the more liquid a coin is, the easier it is to buy or sell it without affecting its price

name: layer-2
description: A layer-2 network is a secondary protocol built on top of an existing blockchain in order to improve its scaling capabilities

name: LP
description: Short for Liquidity Provider or Liquidity Provision

name: margin
description: Margin trading essentially means exchanging coins with borrowed money, with the goal of amplified gains or losses.

name: metrics
description: Places to find information about various crypto protocols and ways to compare them

name: merch
description: Crypto clothing and paraphenalia

name: metaverse
description: Fancy word for the internet

name: news
description: Articles related to current events and news in the world of crypto

name: nft
description: Unlike regular cryptocurrencies, Non Fungible Tokens are each unique and distinct, commonly used to store art and other images

name: options
description: Options are complex financial derivatives, commonly used for accessing leverage or hedging investments

name: order
description: An order is an instruction sent to an exchange to buy or sell crypto - either immediately or given some condition

name: oracle
description: Oracles are the eyes of blockchains; they send information from the outside world to the applications built on them

name: pool
description: A DeFi-native financial primitive, a liquidity pool is essentially a contract holding several people's coins

name: portfolio
description: Tools to help you keep track of your crypto holdings

name: protocol
description: Protocols are basic sets of rules that allow data to be shared between computers. For cryptocurrencies, they establish the structure of the blockchain â€” the distributed database that allows digital money to be securely exchanged on the internet.

name: security
description: Tools and articles to help you keep your crypto safe

name: smart-contract
description: A smart contract is a function or program that runs on a blockchain, most often Ethereum

name: stablecoin
description: A stablecoin is a cryptocurrency that has a stable value, typically tied to the US dollar

name: transaction
description: A transaction is a transfer of value between addresses on a blockchain

name: stake
description: Lock up your crypto for future rewards - like a savings account

name: wallet
description: Wallets are used to store crypto and interact with decentralized applications on blockchains

name: xyk
description: A prevalent market making formula popularised by Uniswap

name: yield
description: In the context of finance, yield measures return for investments/deposits over a set amount of time, expressed as a percentage
